Key Arguments: The bill infringes on freedom of speech, which is a fundamental right.
The government has previously spread misinformation, particularly regarding COVID-19 and vaccines.
There is a concern about who will govern the body deciding what constitutes misinformation or disinformation.
The bill could lead to corruption and is not beneficial to the people of Australia.
The government should not dictate how people think or what opinions they can express.
The bill is seen as a power grab and a step towards communism.
The government should focus on teaching discernment rather than controlling information.
Notable Quotes: This bill is purely trying to stop Freedom of Speech which is our right, and no-one, including the government should be allowed to take away our opinion.
